general_comment:

Well, you've made the most of your second chance, because this time you've done an excellent job and managed to complete every task successfully. It is clear to see how much you have improved.  A+ work!üèÖ

I see that you know how to move from on-prem to the cloud, as you mastered this document. I especially liked that  you picked top notch matching Azure services . **Right on!**üëå

Thank you for submitting an excellent project document; I was **happy to read and review it! **ü§ò 

We can't wait to see your future projects!

### Resource
#### If you want to increase your cloud knowledge, here are some articles for a good start
- [Should I move to the cloud? 8 reasons why you need to](https://xpedition.co.uk/should-i-move-to-the-cloud-8-reasons-why-you-need-to/)
- [A Comprehensive Guide On Microsoft Azure Migration](https://radixweb.com/blog/microsoft-azure-migration-guide)
- [Microsoft Certified: Azure Fundamentals](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/learn/certifications/azure-fundamentals/)"

rubric.stand_out:
1. (Step 1) Identify additional design improvements for your new Azure server farm.
2. (Step 2) Assess whether Contoso would be better off with an SQL Managed Instance, and note Azure Pricing differences.
3. (Step 3) Build and set up a point-to-point (site to site) VPN connection between Contoso‚Äôs on-premises and Contoso‚Äôs Azure environments.
4. (Step 4) Visit the [Azure Templates on GitHub](https://github.com/azure/azure-quickstart-templates) and look at all available templates. Can you find a template that deploys 2 web servers, a load balancer, and a Resource Group? Send the link to the template or a screenshot clearly highlighting the one you will select, and discuss the benefits of using such a template.
5. (Step 5) Create more than one backup policy for each type of data. For example, you may want to create a policy that backs up certain files and folders and not the entire VM‚Äôs hard drive. Try a policy that has folder exclusion and inclusion.

project.name: Moving from On-Prem to the Azure Cloud
project.required_skills:
Familiarity with network concepts, such as IP addressing and routing
Familiarity with network connectivity methods, such as VPN
Familiar with Azure CLI commands
Ability to read JSON 
Understanding of DevOps including container orchestration, CI/CD
Azure Application Development and  Deployment
2+ years experience in developing apps or managing cloud infrastructure that have been deployed using MSFT Azure
